summary:
The Zulu people are a large ethnic group in South Africa, with around 14.39 million members. They are part of the Nguni people and have a rich history dating back to the Bantu migrations. The Zulu nation became powerful under King Shaka's rule due to his military strategies.

Zulus are known for their vibrant ceremonies, like the Reed Dance, and beadwork art, which is an essential part of their culture and communication. Today, most Zulus are Christian but have combined this with their traditional beliefs.
title: Zulu people
